meanings.definition: A piece of absorbent paper used to soak up excess ink or liquid.
meanings.sent1: I used blotters to clean up the spilled juice on the table.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out blotters to the students for the art project.
meanings.sent3: The blotters were so thirsty, they drank up all the water in no time!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like blotters, absorbing all the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The blotters were like little sponges, eager to soak up any mess.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that blots or stains.
meanings.sent1: The ink spilled from the pen and created a blotter on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The muddy shoes left blotters on the clean carpet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was a little blotter, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His careless words acted as blotters on their friendship, leaving stains behind.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops on the window formed tiny blotters, distorting the view outside.

meanings.definition: A police officer who records details of crimes or incidents.
meanings.sent1: The blotter arrived at the scene of the accident to gather information.
meanings.sent2: The detective reviewed the notes made by the blotter during the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy robber tripped over his own feet when he saw the blotter approaching.
meanings.sent4: The blotter's pen was mightier than any weapon, capturing the truth in ink.
meanings.sent5: The blotter's presence was like a shield, protecting the truth from being obscured.
